TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit RowToFieldTransformer extends System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartTransformer implements class System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartField

Docs.summary: Transforms data in a Web Parts connection from a provider that implements the interface to a consumer expecting data through the interface.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Transformers are used to translate data between two Web Parts controls with incompatible connection points. A RowToFieldTransformer object transforms data from a provider implementing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartRow> interface to a consumer requiring data from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartField> interface. The RowToFieldTransformer class allows controls with these incompatible connection points to be connected.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use a RowToFieldTransformer object to connect a provider and consumer with incompatible connection points. The first section of the example shows a Web Parts control that serves as a provider. The provider class, named `RowProviderWebPart`, provides data through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartRow> interface.
[!code-vb[WebParts_RowToFieldTransformer_Overview#1](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_159_1.vb)] [!code-cs[WebParts_RowToFieldTransformer_Overview#1](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_159_1.cs)]
The second section of the example contains a Web Parts control that is a consumer of a Web Parts connection. The consumer class, named `FieldConsumerWebPart`, expects data from the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartField> interface.
[!code-cs[WebParts_RowToFieldTransformer_Overview#2](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_159_2.cs)] [!code-vb[WebParts_RowToFieldTransformer_Overview#2](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_159_2.vb)]
The third section of the example shows a page that contains the two controls and defines the RowToFieldTransformer object for connecting the two controls.
[!code-cs[WebParts_RowToFieldTransformer_Overview#3](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_159_3.aspx)] [!code-vb[WebParts_RowToFieldTransformer_Overview#3](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.web.ui.webcontr_159_3.aspx)]
The code example includes a user control that enables you to change display modes on a Web Parts page. The source code for the user control comes from another topic. You can obtain the .ascx file for the user control from [Walkthrough: Changing Display Modes on a Web Parts Page](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md), and it must be placed in the same folder as the .aspx page.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance class System.Web.UI.Control CreateConfigurationControl() cil managed

Docs.summary: Displays an ASP.NET control that configures a transformer in the zone.
Docs.returns: An ASP.NET control that configures a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks A Web Parts connection can be established statically or dynamically. A static connection is defined within the `<StaticConnections>` tag. A user can define a dynamic connection when a connections zone is included in a web page and the user is in the connect mode. When establishing a dynamic connection, the user defines the connection through a configuration control. The CreateConfigurationControl method returns the control that the user interacts with to define the connection.
The configuration control for a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.RowToFieldTransformer> object allows a user to connect or disconnect a provider and consumer, and select which field from the provider row to connect with the data field of the consumer. It is displayed in the connections zone. The user's configuration settings will be saved, and loaded on the next visit.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the name of the value to transform.
Docs.value: A <xref:System.String> containing the name of the field to transform.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The FieldName property represents the data from the provider row that will be transformed for the consumer. The FieldName property can be set by the user through the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.RowToFieldTransformer> configuration control, or set declaratively in the `<asp:RowToFieldTransformer FieldName="`*selectedField*`" />` tag, where *selectedField* contains the name of the field to transform.

.method familyorassemblyhidebysig virtual instance object SaveConfigurationState() cil managed

Docs.param: The delegate instance to be used when retrieving a value.
Docs.summary: Returns the value of the field that is being used by the interface as the basis of a connection between two Web Parts controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.RowToFieldTransformer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartField> interface.

Docs.summary: Gets the schema information for a data field that is used to share data between two Web Parts controls.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This member is an explicit interface member implementation. It can be used only when the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.RowToFieldTransformer> instance is cast to an <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartField> interface.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig virtual instance object Transform(object providerData) cil managed

Docs.param: The provider data to be transformed.
Docs.summary: Provides an object for transforming the data.
Docs.returns: An <xref:System.Object> representing the data to be transformed.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The Transform method provides an object for transforming the provider data from the type <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartRow> to the type <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.IWebPartField> so it can be used by the consumer.
